page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO NANTGLYN.
page.content: The Nantglyn area is situated 4.5 miles S.W. of Denbigh,Clwyd.It lies between the lowlands of the Vale of Clwyd and the Hiraethog Moors to the West. It is a hilly landscape with summits averaging 3oom. with many steep sided valleys whose streams flow to the North and East.The largest of these valleys is the Ystrad which contains Nantglyn village. The area is totally Welsh in character with 69% of the population speaking the language. The chapels,eisteddfodau, Merched y Wawr,and other Welsh institutions are thriving. The largest settlement is Nantglyn village. It has about 40 houses, a sub-post office 3 chapels and a school.There is a hamlet at Saron,and many well kept sheep farms and isolated houses.
